input.content:
#!/bin/bash
# database/scripts/sync_dev_data.sh
# deploy-test í”„ë¡œë•ì…˜ DBì˜ ì½˜í…ì¸  í…Œì´ë¸”ì„ ê°œë°œ DBì— ë™ê¸°í™”í•œë‹¤.
#
# ì‚¬ìš©ë²•:
#   bash database/scripts/sync_dev_data.sh [target_db_url]
#
# ê¸°ë³¸ ëŒ€ìƒ: infra-server ê³µìœ  dev DB
# ì˜ˆì‹œ:
#   bash database/scripts/sync_dev_data.sh postgresql://narative:password@localhost:5433/narrative_invest
#
# ì „ì œì¡°ê±´:
#   - deploy-test SSH ì ‘ì† ê°€ëŠ¥ (ssh deploy-test)
#   - psql í´ë¼ì´ì–¸íŠ¸ ì„¤ì¹˜ (apt install postgresql-client)
#   - ëŒ€ìƒ DBì— ìŠ¤í‚¤ë§ˆê°€ ì´ë¯¸ ì¡´ì¬í•´ì•¼ í•¨ (alembic upgrade head ì™„ë£Œ ìƒíƒœ)

set -euo pipefail

TARGET_URL="${1:-postgresql://narative:password@10.10.10.10:5432/narrative_invest}"
PROD_HOST="deploy-test"
PROD_CONTAINER="adelie-postgres"
PROD_DB="narrative_invest"
PROD_USER="narative"

# ë™ê¸°í™”í•  ì½˜í…ì¸  í…Œì´ë¸” (ìŠ¤í‚¤ë§ˆ í…Œì´ë¸” ì œì™¸)
CONTENT_TABLES=(
  "stock_listings"
  "daily_briefings"
  "briefing_stocks"
  "historical_cases"
  "case_matches"
  "case_stock_relations"
  "broker_reports"
)

echo "=== deploy-test â†’ dev DB ì½˜í…ì¸  ë™ê¸°í™” ==="
echo "ëŒ€ìƒ DB: ${TARGET_URL}"
echo ""

# psql í´ë¼ì´ì–¸íŠ¸ í™•ì¸
if ! command -v psql &>/dev/null; then
  echo "âŒ psqlì„ ì°¾ì„ ìˆ˜ ì—†ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. postgresql-clientë¥¼ ì„¤ì¹˜í•˜ì„¸ìš”:"
  echo "   sudo apt install postgresql-client"
  exit 1
fi

# deploy-test SSH ì ‘ì† í™•ì¸
if ! ssh -o ConnectTimeout=5 "${PROD_HOST}" "echo ok" &>/dev/null; then
  echo "âŒ ${PROD_HOST} SSH ì ‘ì† ì‹¤íŒ¨. ~/.ssh/config ë˜ëŠ” SSH í‚¤ë¥¼ í™•ì¸í•˜ì„¸ìš”."
  exit 1
fi

echo "âœ… deploy-test SSH ì ‘ì† í™•ì¸"
echo ""

# í…Œì´ë¸”ë³„ ë¤í”„ & ì ìš©
for tbl in "${CONTENT_TABLES[@]}"; do
  echo -n "  ${tbl} ë™ê¸°í™” ì¤‘... "

  # prodì—ì„œ data-only ë¤í”„ â†’ ëŒ€ìƒ DBì— ì§ì ‘ ì ìš©
  # TRUNCATE CASCADEë¡œ ê¸°ì¡´ ë°ì´í„° ì‚­ì œ í›„ INSERT
  ssh "${PROD_HOST}" \
    "docker exec ${PROD_CONTAINER} pg_dump \
      -U ${PROD_USER} -d ${PROD_DB} \
      -t ${tbl} --data-only --disable-triggers \
      --column-inserts 2>/dev/null" \
  | (
    # TRUNCATE ë¨¼ì € ì‹¤í–‰ (FK ì œì•½ ë¹„í™œì„±í™”)
    echo "SET session_replication_role = replica;"
    echo "TRUNCATE TABLE ${tbl} CASCADE;"
    cat
    echo "SET session_replication_role = DEFAULT;"
  ) \
  | psql "${TARGET_URL}" -q 2>/dev/null

  echo "âœ…"
done

echo ""
echo "=== ë™ê¸°í™” ì™„ë£Œ ==="
echo ""
echo "ë°ì´í„° í™•ì¸:"
psql "${TARGET_URL}" -c \
  "SELECT 'daily_briefings' AS tbl, count(*) FROM daily_briefings
   UNION ALL SELECT 'historical_cases', count(*) FROM historical_cases
   UNION ALL SELECT 'stock_listings', count(*) FROM stock_listings;" \
  2>/dev/null || echo "  (í…Œì´ë¸” í™•ì¸ ì‹¤íŒ¨ â€” DB ì ‘ì† ì •ë³´ë¥¼ í™•ì¸í•˜ì„¸ìš”)"

content.thinking:
The check-lxd-git output shows:

1. `dev-yj99son`: HTTPS with token (gho_*), git user set correctly (YJ99Son / syjin2008@naver.com), but SSH not authenticated (empty response after StrictHostKeyChecking warning - means ssh-T git@github.com returned nothing, which means no SSH key or not authenticated)
2. `dev-j2hoon10`: HTTPS without token, git user config not set â†’ ì—°ê²° ì‹¤íŒ¨ (lxc exec error - maybe the path doesn't exist or the command failed mid-way)


3. `dev-jjjh02`, `dev-ryejinn`: Both show HTTPS without token and ì—°ê²° ì‹¤íŒ¨, though the remote URL appears in the output before the error
4. `dev-hj`: HTTPS with token (same as yj99son), git user configured correctly (dorae222 / dhj9842@gmail.com), but SSH also not authenticated

The ì—°ê²° ì‹¤íŒ¨ pattern for containers without tokens is oddâ€”the remote shows up but then fails, which suggests the bash command might be breaking partway through execution.

Looking at the actual command structure, if `git config user.name` or `git config user.email` returns a non-zero exit code because those values aren't set, that would cause the entire command to fail and trigger the error message, even though we're not explicitly using `set -e`.

That explains why dev-j2hoon10, dev-jjjh02, and dev-ryejinn are all showing connection failuresâ€”their git user configuration is missing. Meanwhile, dev-yj99son and dev-hj are using HTTPS with tokens, but the SSH test isn't returning the expected "Hi username!" response, suggesting either no SSH key is configured or it's not registered on GitHub for those accounts.

I should refactor the check-lxd-git command to gracefully handle missing git config values instead of letting them break the whole check. I see the compound bash command is failing because git config isn't set on those servers. There's also a security issueâ€”a GitHub token is visible in the remote URL output, so I should warn the user about that. Looking at the SSH tests, both dev-yj99son and dev-hj returned empty responses instead of the expected GitHub greeting, which suggests their SSH keys either aren't present or aren't registered with GitHub. I'm going to update the check-lxd-git target to handle missing git config more gracefully.

Updating the Makefile and MEMORY.md with these findings, then I'll summarize everything for the user and outline the next steps for getting SSH properly configured.

content.content:
1â†’# Adelie Investment - Project Memory
     2â†’
     3â†’## Project Overview
     4â†’- Financial education platform: "History Repeats Itself" - past-present case matching
     5â†’- Stack: React 19 + Vite (frontend), FastAPI (backend), PostgreSQL + Redis + MinIO
     6â†’- Mobile-first (max-width: 480px), Korean language UI
     7â†’
     8â†’## Key Architecture (v14 - datapipeline í†µí•© + auth ì •ë¦¬)
     9â†’- **Backend**: `fastapi/app/` â€” ìœ ì¼í•œ ë°±ì—”ë“œ (auth í¬í•¨)
    10â†’- **Chatbot**: `chatbot/` (tutor agent + tools)
    11â†’- **Data Pipeline**: `datapipeline/` â€” 18ë…¸ë“œ LangGraph ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ íŒŒì´í”„ë¼ì¸
    12â†’  - `nodes/` (crawlers, screening, curation, interface1~3, db_save)
    13â†’  - `data_collection/` (news_crawler, research_crawler, screener, etc.)
    14â†’  - `ai/` (multi_provider_client, llm_utils)
    15â†’  - `db/` (writer.py â€” asyncpg DB ì €ì¥)
    16â†’  - `collectors/` (ë ˆê±°ì‹œ pykrx â€” FastAPI sys.path í˜¸í™˜)
    17â†’  - `scripts/` (ë ˆê±°ì‹œ íŒŒì´í”„ë¼ì¸ â€” generate_cases, seed ë“±)
    18â†’  - `prompts/templates/` (9ê°œ ìƒˆ .md í…œí”Œë¦¿)
    19â†’- **Database**: `database/` (alembic migrations + DB scripts)
    20â†’- **Frontend**: `frontend/src/` with pages/, components/, contexts/, api/
    21â†’- **Tests**: `tests/{unit,backend,integration}/` + `datapipeline/tests/`
    22â†’- interface/ í´ë” â†’ datapipelineìœ¼ë¡œ í†µí•© ì™„ë£Œ (2026-02-13)
    23â†’
    24â†’## Auth Pattern (v14)
    25â†’- ëª¨ë“  API: JWT í† í° ê¸°ë°˜ ì¸ì¦ (`get_current_user` / `get_current_user_optional`)
    26â†’- portfolio, learning, notification: user_id path param ì œê±°, JWTì—ì„œ ì¶”ì¶œ
    27â†’- tutor: optional auth (ë¯¸ì¸ì¦ ì‹œ í¬íŠ¸í´ë¦¬ì˜¤ ì»¨í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ ìƒëµ)
    28â†’- í”„ë¡ íŠ¸ì—”ë“œ: `fetchJson`/`postJson`ì´ Authorization í—¤ë” ìë™ í¬í•¨
    29â†’
    30â†’## Patterns
    31â†’- Models: SQLAlchemy async with `mapped_column`, `app.core.database.Base`
    32â†’- Schemas: Pydantic v2 in `app/schemas/` and `datapipeline/schemas.py`
    33â†’- Routes: FastAPI APIRouter, prefix="/api/v1"
    34â†’- Frontend API: domain-separated files in `src/api/`, using `fetchJson`/`postJson` from client.js
    35â†’- Prompts: markdown templates with frontmatter (provider, model, temperature, thinking)
    36â†’- Pipeline: LangGraph StateGraph â†’ `python -m datapipeline.run --backend live --market KR`
    37â†’- **KST ë‚ ì§œ ì²˜ë¦¬**: ì„œë²„ê°€ UTCì—¬ë„ KST ê¸°ì¤€ ë‚ ì§œ ì‚¬ìš©
    38â†’  - datapipeline: `from datapipeline.config import KST, kst_today`
    39â†’  - FastAPI: `from datetime import timezone, timedelta; KST = timezone(timedelta(hours=9))`
    40â†’  - `date.today()`, `datetime.now().date()` ì‚¬ìš© ê¸ˆì§€ â†’ `kst_today()` ë˜ëŠ” `datetime.now(KST).date()`
    41â†’
    42â†’## Key Paths
    43â†’- Alembic: `cd database && alembic upgrade head`
    44â†’- FastAPI Dockerfile: context=., dockerfile=fastapi/Dockerfile
    45â†’- Datapipeline Dockerfile: context=., dockerfile=datapipeline/Dockerfile
    46â†’- Pipeline run: `python -m datapipeline.run --backend mock` (í…ŒìŠ¤íŠ¸) / `--backend live` (ì‹¤í–‰)
    47â†’
    48â†’## Important Notes
    49â†’- Docker service: backend-apië§Œ ì¡´ì¬ (backend-spring ì œê±°ë¨)
    50â†’- nginx: /api/auth/* â†’ /api/v1/auth/* rewriteë¡œ ë ˆê±°ì‹œ í˜¸í™˜
    51â†’- datapipeline config: PROJECT_ROOT/.envë§Œ ì‚¬ìš© (ëª¨ë“ˆë³„ .env ì—†ìŒ)
    52â†’- collectors/ëŠ” FastAPIì—ì„œ sys.path.insertë¡œ import (ë ˆê±°ì‹œ í˜¸í™˜)
    53â†’
    54â†’## ì¸í”„ë¼ ìƒì„¸ â†’ [infra-ops.md](./infra-ops.md)
    55â†’- Python ê°€ìƒí™˜ê²½ ì¼€ì´ìŠ¤ë³„ ì‚¬ìš©ë²• (ë¡œì»¬ vs Docker vs ì›ê²©)

# Adelie Investment - Project Memory

## Project Overview
- Financial education platform: "History Repeats Itself" - past-present case matching
- Stack: React 19 + Vite (frontend), FastAPI (backend), PostgreSQL + Redis + MinIO
- Mobile-first (max-width: 480px), Korean language UI

## Key Architecture (v14 - datapipeline í†µí•© + auth ì •ë¦¬)
- **Backend**: `fastapi/app/` â€” ìœ ì¼í•œ ë°±ì—”ë“œ (auth í¬í•¨)
- **Chatbot**: `chatbot/` (tutor agent + tools)
- **Data Pipeline**: `datapipeline/` â€” 18ë…¸ë“œ LangGraph ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ íŒŒì´í”„ë¼ì¸
  - `nodes/` (crawlers, screening, curation, interface1~3, db_save)
  - `data_collection/` (news_crawler, research_crawler, screener, etc.)
  - `ai/` (multi_provider_client, llm_utils)
  - `db/` (writer.py â€” asyncpg DB ì €ì¥)
  - `collectors/` (ë ˆê±°ì‹œ pykrx â€” FastAPI sys.path í˜¸í™˜)
  - `scripts/` (ë ˆê±°ì‹œ íŒŒì´í”„ë¼ì¸ â€” generate_cases, seed ë“±)
  - `prompts/templates/` (9ê°œ ìƒˆ .md í…œí”Œë¦¿)
- **Database**: `database/` (alembic migrations + DB scripts)
- **Frontend**: `frontend/src/` with pages/, components/, contexts/, api/
- **Tests**: `tests/{unit,backend,integration}/` + `datapipeline/tests/`
- interface/ í´ë” â†’ datapipelineìœ¼ë¡œ í†µí•© ì™„ë£Œ (2026-02-13)

## Auth Pattern (v14)
- ëª¨ë“  API: JWT í† í° ê¸°ë°˜ ì¸ì¦ (`get_current_user` / `get_current_user_optional`)
- portfolio, learning, notification: user_id path param ì œê±°, JWTì—ì„œ ì¶”ì¶œ
- tutor: optional auth (ë¯¸ì¸ì¦ ì‹œ í¬íŠ¸í´ë¦¬ì˜¤ ì»¨í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ ìƒëµ)
- í”„ë¡ íŠ¸ì—”ë“œ: `fetchJson`/`postJson`ì´ Authorization í—¤ë” ìë™ í¬í•¨

## Patterns
- Models: SQLAlchemy async with `mapped_column`, `app.core.database.Base`
- Schemas: Pydantic v2 in `app/schemas/` and `datapipeline/schemas.py`
- Routes: FastAPI APIRouter, prefix="/api/v1"
- Frontend API: domain-separated files in `src/api/`, using `fetchJson`/`postJson` from client.js
- Prompts: markdown templates with frontmatter (provider, model, temperature, thinking)
- Pipeline: LangGraph StateGraph â†’ `python -m datapipeline.run --backend live --market KR`
- **KST ë‚ ì§œ ì²˜ë¦¬**: ì„œë²„ê°€ UTCì—¬ë„ KST ê¸°ì¤€ ë‚ ì§œ ì‚¬ìš©
  - datapipeline: `from datapipeline.config import KST, kst_today`
  - FastAPI: `from datetime import timezone, timedelta; KST = timezone(timedelta(hours=9))`
  - `date.today()`, `datetime.now().date()` ì‚¬ìš© ê¸ˆì§€ â†’ `kst_today()` ë˜ëŠ” `datetime.now(KST).date()`

## Key Paths
- Alembic: `cd database && alembic upgrade head`
- FastAPI Dockerfile: context=., dockerfile=fastapi/Dockerfile
- Datapipeline Dockerfile: context=., dockerfile=datapipeline/Dockerfile

# Adelie Investment - Project Memory

## Project Overview
- Financial education platform: "History Repeats Itself" - past-present case matching
- Stack: React 19 + Vite (frontend), FastAPI (backend), PostgreSQL + Redis + MinIO
- Mobile-first (max-width: 480px), Korean language UI

## Key Architecture (v14 - datapipeline í†µí•© + auth ì •ë¦¬)
- **Backend**: `fastapi/app/` â€” ìœ ì¼í•œ ë°±ì—”ë“œ (auth í¬í•¨)
- **Chatbot**: `chatbot/` (tutor agent + tools)
- **Data Pipeline**: `datapipeline/` â€” 18ë…¸ë“œ LangGraph ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ íŒŒì´í”„ë¼ì¸
  - `nodes/` (crawlers, screening, curation, interface1~3, db_save)
  - `data_collection/` (news_crawler, research_crawler, screener, etc.)
  - `ai/` (multi_provider_client, llm_utils)
  - `db/` (writer.py â€” asyncpg DB ì €ì¥)
  - `collectors/` (ë ˆê±°ì‹œ pykrx â€” FastAPI sys.path í˜¸í™˜)
  - `scripts/` (ë ˆê±°ì‹œ íŒŒì´í”„ë¼ì¸ â€” generate_cases, seed ë“±)
  - `prompts/templates/` (9ê°œ ìƒˆ .md í…œí”Œë¦¿)
- **Database**: `database/` (alembic migrations + DB scripts)
- **Frontend**: `frontend/src/` with pages/, components/, contexts/, api/

- interface/ í´ë” â†’ datapipelineìœ¼ë¡œ í†µí•© ì™„ë£Œ (2026-02-13)

## Auth Pattern (v14)
- ëª¨ë“  API: JWT í† í° ê¸°ë°˜ ì¸ì¦ (`get_current_user` / `get_current_user_optional`)

## Patterns

content.thinking:
The user is asking whether there's a problem if they don't register the SSH public keys on GitHub.

Let me think about this carefully:

1. **dev-yj99son** and **dev-hj**: These already use HTTPS with a token (gho_* token embedded in the remote URL). This means they can already push/pull via HTTPS with the token. SSH key registration is not strictly necessary for them.

2. **dev-j2hoon10**, **dev-jjjh02**, **dev-ryejinn**: These use plain HTTPS without a token. They can pull (public repo or with credentials), but pushing would require either:
   - A GitHub personal access token (PAT) in the remote URL
   - SSH key authentication
   - GitHub username/password (deprecated, no longer supported)

So the real issue is whether those three servers without tokens can push to GitHub. The answer is noâ€”they need either SSH keys registered or a PAT embedded in the remote URL, since GitHub removed password-based authentication in August 2021. For pulling from a public repo, plain HTTPS works fine, but I need to check whether the repo is private or public to fully assess the situation.

If the repo is private, even pulling requires authentication. Looking at the actual consequences: the two servers already using HTTPS with tokens are fine for daily work, while the other three servers can only pull from public repos without credentials but can't push anywhere without either an SSH key, a PAT, or GitHub CLI authentication. So SSH key registration isn't strictly necessary for the servers that already have tokens, but it is necessary for the others to push. For j2hoon10, jjjh02, and ryejinn, I need to either set up HTTPS with a personal access token like yj99son and hj have, or register their SSH keys on GitHub. The token approach is probably simpler since it just requires updating the remote URL.

Now I have a comprehensive picture. Let me synthesize the findings and write a plan.

Key findings:
1. **All dev/* branches are behind develop** (not ahead). This means no one has pushed new commits from their LXD servers to their feature branches. The work they're doing is all in stash or untracked files.

2. **dev-yj99son**: Has 2 meaningful stashes:
   - stash@{2}: UI refactoring (í­ê·„ ë§ˆìŠ¤ì½”íŠ¸, íŠœí„° ëª¨ë‹¬, í”„ë¡œí•„) â€” 17 files
   - stash@{3}: Datapipeline/fastapi narrative improvements â€” 10 files
   
   Both are sitting locally and haven't been pushed yet.

3. **dev-jjjh02**: Has an untracked API smoke test documentation file and a stash with reports endpoint work in progress.

4. **dev-ryejinn**: Has an untracked service planning document.

5. **dev-hj** and **dev-j2hoon10**: No uncommitted work.

The main issue is that yj99son has significant work stashed away that needs to be recovered and integrated.

Now looking at push capabilities â€” yj99son can push with their HTTPS token already configured, but jjjh02 and ryejinn are blocked until they set up personal access tokens. Meanwhile, all the dev branches are trailing develop by 5 commits, so there's some catching up needed once the push access is sorted out. -10 commits (meaning the develop branch has moved ahead). This means the LXD servers need `sync-lxd` to pull the latest develop changes.

What needs to happen:
1. **sync-lxd**: Run sync to pull latest develop changes into each dev/* branch on LXD servers
2. **yj99son**: Has stash work that should be committed and pushed (UI refactoring)
3. **jjjh02**: Has stash work that needs PAT first before pushing
4. **ryejinn**: Has untracked file that needs PAT first before pushing

I can automate the safe operations like syncing dev branches and pulling the latest code to LXD servers, then notify yj99son to pop their stash and commit, while jjjh02 and ryejinn wait for their PAT before proceeding. Let me write out a concise plan covering what was found and what actions are needed. I'm realizing I mixed up the git command logicâ€”the script calculates commits in develop that aren't in the branch (behind count) and commits in the branch that aren't in develop (ahead count), but then outputs them in the wrong order, which is why the numbers seemed backwards. I see the variable naming is backwards from what they representâ€”`ahead` actually counts commits develop has that the branch doesn't (making the branch behind), while `behind` counts commits the branch has that develop doesn't (making it ahead). So dev/frontend being 5 commits behind means develop has 5 newer commits, and since all dev/* branches show 0 ahead, the team's stashed work was never committed or pushed before the sync happened.

The immediate fix is to sync develop's latest commits into each dev/* branch using the Makefile, then pull those changes on the LXD servers. After that, the team members need to pop their stashes and push their workâ€”yj99son has UI refactoring and narrative changes to commit, while jjjh02 and ryejinn need to set up their PAT tokens first before pushing their stashed changes.

Then I need to decide what to do with refactoring.md and service-plan-current.md, and once the team members have their PATs configured, I can apply those tokens to their server remote URLs.

Looking at the actual execution plan, I can run the sync commands myself since the dev branches are just behind develop with no conflictsâ€”it'll be a straightforward fast-forward merge. After that, I'll notify the team about the stashed changes that need attention. ê° ë‹´ë‹¹ìê°€ ì„œë¡œ ë‹¤ë¥¸ PATë¥¼ ê°€ì§€ê³  ìˆìœ¼ë‹ˆ ìë™í™”ëœ ë‹¨ì¼ ëª…ë ¹ì–´ë¡œëŠ” ë¶ˆê°€ëŠ¥í•˜ê³ , ê°œë³„ì ìœ¼ë¡œ PATë¥¼ ìˆ˜ì§‘í•´ì„œ ê°ê° ì ìš©í•´ì•¼ í•œë‹¤. ì´ì œ ê³„íš íŒŒì¼ì„ ì‘ì„±í•´ì•¼ê² ë‹¤.

content.thinking:
The user is asking whether PAT needs only repo permissions. Let me answer this clearly.

For GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) used for git operations (clone, push, pull):
- Classic PAT: needs `repo` scope (full control of private repositories)
- Fine-grained PAT: needs "Contents" read/write permission on the specific repository

Since this is for git push/pull operations on a private repository (404-NFYet/adelie-investment), they need:
- **Classic PAT**: `repo` scope (includes read/write for private repos)
- **Fine-grained PAT**: Repository access â†’ Contents (Read and write)


- For public repos, no token would be required, but since this is a private repository, the repo scope is essential for authentication.
